page.title: 02ENTERTAINMENT IN CLEETHORPES
page.content: In 1985 Cleethorpes possesses little {public entertainment}other than {arcades}and{bingo halls. Disco dancing is usually available at Deans, Clouds and Mc Cartneys.However, the{pier, once the scene of Music Hall, concerts dancing and lately Roller Skating is not in use.The Empire Theatre is an amusement arcade and the once flourishing Bunny's Club is no more. The ABC Cinema is a bingo hall.The Memorial Hall is one of the chief sources of entertainment with plays, pantomimes,exhibitions,flower shows and charity events.Wonderland provides,in addition to rides and electronic amusement machines, popular exhibitions and markets.
